refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: All drawing operations in GDK take a graphics context (GC) argument. A graphics context encapsulates information about the way things are drawn, such as the foreground color or line width. By using graphics contexts, the number of arguments to each drawing call is greatly reduced, and communication overhead is minimized, since identical arguments do not need to be passed repeatedly.

Most values of a graphics context can be set at creation time by using gdk_gc_new_with_values(), or can be set one-by-one using functions such as gdk_gc_set_foreground(). A few of the values in the GC, such as the dash pattern, can only be set by the latter method.

refsect2.title: struct GdkGC
refsect2.para: The GdkGC structure represents a graphics context. It is an opaque structure with no user-visible elements.

refsect2.title: struct GdkGCValues
refsect2.para: The GdkGCValues structure holds a set of values used to create or modify a graphics context.

listitem.simpara: the bitwise operation used when drawing.
the x origin of the tile or stipple.
the y origin of the tile or stipple.
the x origin of the clip mask.
the y origin of the clip mask.
the way dashed lines are drawn.
the way the ends of lines are drawn.
the way joins between lines are drawn.

refsect2.title: enum GdkGCValuesMask
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GDK_GC_FOREGROUND = 1 << 0, GDK_GC_BACKGROUND = 1 << 1, GDK_GC_FONT = 1 << 2, GDK_GC_FUNCTION = 1 << 3, GDK_GC_FILL = 1 << 4, GDK_GC_TILE = 1 << 5, GDK_GC_STIPPLE = 1 << 6, GDK_GC_CLIP_MASK = 1 << 7, GDK_GC_SUBWINDOW = 1 << 8, GDK_GC_TS_X_ORIGIN = 1 << 9, GDK_GC_TS_Y_ORIGIN = 1 << 10, GDK_GC_CLIP_X_ORIGIN = 1 << 11, GDK_GC_CLIP_Y_ORIGIN = 1 << 12, GDK_GC_EXPOSURES = 1 << 13, GDK_GC_LINE_WIDTH = 1 << 14, GDK_GC_LINE_STYLE = 1 << 15, GDK_GC_CAP_STYLE = 1 << 16, GDK_GC_JOIN_STYLE = 1 << 17 } GdkGCValuesMask;
refsect2.para: A set of bit flags used to indicate which fields GdkGCValues structure are set.

refsect2.title: enum GdkFunction
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GDK_COPY, GDK_INVERT, GDK_XOR, GDK_CLEAR, GDK_AND, GDK_AND_REVERSE, GDK_AND_INVERT, GDK_NOOP, GDK_OR, GDK_EQUIV, GDK_OR_REVERSE, GDK_COPY_INVERT, GDK_OR_INVERT, GDK_NAND, GDK_NOR, GDK_SET } GdkFunction;
refsect2.para: Determines how the bit values for the source pixels are combined with the bit values for destination pixels to produce the final result. The sixteen values here correspond to the 16 different possible 2x2 truth tables. Only a couple of these values are usually useful; for colored images, only GDK_COPY, GDK_XOR and GDK_INVERT are generally useful. For bitmaps, GDK_AND and GDK_OR are also useful.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new graphics context with default values.

listitem.simpara: a GdkDrawable. The created GC must always be used with drawables of the same depth as this one.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_new_with_values ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GC with the given initial values.

listitem.simpara: a GdkDrawable. The created GC must always be used with drawables of the same depth as this one.
a structure containing initial values for the GC.
a bit mask indicating which fields in values are set.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_get_screen ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GdkScreen for which gc was created
Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_ref ()

warning.para: gdk_gc_ref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated function; use g_object_ref() instead.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_unref ()

warning.para: gdk_gc_unref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated function; use g_object_unref() instead.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_destroy

warning.para: gdk_gc_destroy is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Identical to gdk_gc_unref(). This function is obsolete and should not be used.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_values ()
refsect2.para: Sets attributes of a graphics context in bulk. For each flag set in values_mask, the corresponding field will be read from values and set as the new value for gc. If you're only setting a few values on gc, calling individual "setter" functions is likely more convenient.

listitem.simpara: mask indicating which struct fields are to be used

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_get_values ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the current values from a graphics context.

listitem.simpara: the GdkGCValues structure in which to store the results.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_foreground ()
refsect2.para: Sets the foreground color for a graphics context.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_background ()
refsect2.para: Sets the background color for a graphics context.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_rgb_fg_color ()
refsect2.para: Set the foreground color of a GC using an unallocated color. The pixel value for the color will be determined using GdkRGB. If the colormap for the GC has not previously been initialized for GdkRGB, then for pseudo-color colormaps (colormaps with a small modifiable number of colors), a colorcube will be allocated in the colormap.
Calling this function for a GC without a colormap is an error.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_rgb_bg_color ()
refsect2.para: Set the background color of a GC using an unallocated color. The pixel value for the color will be determined using GdkRGB. If the colormap for the GC has not previously been initialized for GdkRGB, then for pseudo-color colormaps (colormaps with a small modifiable number of colors), a colorcube will be allocated in the colormap.
Calling this function for a GC without a colormap is an error.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_font ()

warning.para: gdk_gc_set_font is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the font for a graphics context. (Note that all text-drawing functions in GDK take a font argument; the value set here is used when that argument is NULL.)

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_function ()
refsect2.para: Determines how the current pixel values and the pixel values being drawn are combined to produce the final pixel values.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_fill ()
refsect2.para: Set the fill mode for a graphics context.

refsect2.title: enum GdkFill
refsect2.para: Determines how primitives are drawn.

listitem.simpara: draw using the stipple bitmap. Pixels corresponding to bits in the stipple bitmap that are set will be drawn in the foreground color; pixels corresponding to bits that are not set will be left untouched.

draw using the stipple bitmap. Pixels corresponding to bits in the stipple bitmap that are set will be drawn in the foreground color; pixels corresponding to bits that are not set will be drawn with the background color.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_tile ()
refsect2.para: Set a tile pixmap for a graphics context. This will only be used if the fill mode is GDK_TILED.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_stipple ()
refsect2.para: Set the stipple bitmap for a graphics context. The stipple will only be used if the fill mode is GDK_STIPPLED or GDK_OPAQUE_STIPPLED.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_ts_origin ()
refsect2.para: Set the origin when using tiles or stipples with the GC. The tile or stipple will be aligned such that the upper left corner of the tile or stipple will coincide with this point.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_clip_origin ()
refsect2.para: Sets the origin of the clip mask. The coordinates are interpreted relative to the upper-left corner of the destination drawable of the current operation.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_clip_mask ()
refsect2.para: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a bitmap. The clip mask is interpreted relative to the clip origin. (See gdk_gc_set_clip_origin()).

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_clip_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a rectangle. The clip mask is interpreted relative to the clip origin. (See gdk_gc_set_clip_origin()).

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_clip_region ()
refsect2.para: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a region structure. The clip mask is interpreted relative to the clip origin. (See gdk_gc_set_clip_origin()).

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_subwindow ()
refsect2.para: Sets how drawing with this GC on a window will affect child windows of that window.

refsect2.title: enum GdkSubwindowMode
refsect2.para: Determines how drawing onto a window will affect child windows of that window.

listitem.simpara: only draw onto the window itself.
draw onto the window and child windows.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_exposures ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether copying non-visible portions of a drawable using this graphics context generate exposure events for the corresponding regions of the destination drawable. (See gdk_draw_drawable()).

listitem.simpara: if TRUE, exposure events will be generated.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_line_attributes ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gdk_gc_set_line_attributes (GdkGC *gc, gint line_width, GdkLineStyle line_style, GdkCapStyle cap_style, GdkJoinStyle join_style);
refsect2.para: Sets various attributes of how lines are drawn. See the corresponding members of GdkGCValues for full explanations of the arguments.

listitem.simpara: the manner in which the ends of lines are drawn.
the in which lines are joined together.

refsect2.title: enum GdkLineStyle
refsect2.para: Determines how lines are drawn.

listitem.simpara: even segments are drawn; odd segments are not drawn.
even segments are normally. Odd segments are drawn in the background color if the fill style is GDK_SOLID, or in the background color masked by the stipple if the fill style is GDK_STIPPLED.

refsect2.title: enum GdkCapStyle
refsect2.para: Determines how the end of lines are drawn.

listitem.simpara: the same as GDK_CAP_BUTT for lines of non-zero width. for zero width lines, the final point on the line will not be drawn.
the ends of the lines are drawn squared off and extending to the coordinates of the end point.
the ends of the lines are drawn as semicircles with the diameter equal to the line width and centered at the end point.
the ends of the lines are drawn squared off and extending half the width of the line beyond the end point.

refsect2.title: enum GdkJoinStyle
refsect2.para: Determines how the joins between segments of a polygon are drawn.

listitem.simpara: the sides of each line are extended to meet at an angle.
the sides of the two lines are joined by a circular arc.
the sides of the two lines are joined by a straight line which makes an equal angle with each line.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_dashes ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gdk_gc_set_dashes (GdkGC *gc, gint dash_offset, gint8 dash_list[], gint n);
refsect2.para: Sets the way dashed-lines are drawn. Lines will be drawn with alternating on and off segments of the lengths specified in dash_list. The manner in which the on and off segments are drawn is determined by the line_style value of the GC. (This can be changed with gdk_gc_set_line_attributes())

listitem.simpara: the number of elements in dash_list.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_copy ()
refsect2.para: Copy the set of values from one graphics context onto another graphics context.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_set_colormap ()
refsect2.para: Sets the colormap for the GC to the given colormap. The depth of the colormap's visual must match the depth of the drawable for which the GC was created.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_get_colormap ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the colormap for a given GC, if it exists. A GC will have a colormap if the drawable for which it was created has a colormap, or if a colormap was set explicitely with gdk_gc_set_colormap.

refsect2.title: gdk_gc_offset ()
refsect2.para: Offset attributes such as the clip and tile-stipple origins of the GC so that drawing at x - x_offset, y - y_offset with the offset GC has the same effect as drawing at x, y with the original GC.

listitem.simpara: amount by which to offset the GC in the X direction
amount by which to offset the GC in the Y direction
